candidates.title: Ted Nugent Death Hoax
candidates.content:
Claim:
Ted Nugent was killed in a Montana hunting accident.
On 28 April 2017, a number of unreliable web sites began publishing stories reporting that rock musician and conservative icon Ted Nugent had been killed in a hunting accident in Montana:
Ted Nugent, 70’s rocker turned hunting guide and conservative icon, was shot and killed early this morning in a tragic hunting accident. While setting up his tree stand just outside a wildlife reserve in Montana, Nugent was fired on and hit in the chest by a hunter with a scope nearly a quarter of a mile away who believed he was a brown bear.
There are no legitimate news reports of any ill fate befalling Nugent — in fact, he made a Facebook Live video with his wife Shermane on the same afternoon the death hoax starting circulating, in which they confirmed he is indeed alive and well:
She posted another live video a few minutes later in which her husband's voice could be heard while she played with the couple's dogs:
Nugent's spokeswoman Linda Peterson also confirmed in an e-mail that reports of Nugent's untimely death were "fake news."
Nugent is famous for his rock career, but has also become an outspoken supporter of conservative political figures, such as former Alaska Governor Sarah Palin and President Donald Trump. He most recently made news when he was pictured alongside Palin and fellow rock singer Kid Rock at the White House, where they all dined with President Trump. Nugent is also a divisive figure due to comments he has made about former President Barack Obama and Secretary of State Hillary Clinton that have been characterized as racist, sexist and potentially inciting violence.
candidates.description: Despite rumors that the rocker was killed in a hunting accident in Montana, he remains alive and well.

result.explanation: This assessment is evidence-based. The news caption, "Ted Nugent was killed in a Montana hunting accident," is judged as FALSE based on the provided evidence from Snopes.  Snopes explicitly debunks this claim, stating that it was a hoax. They cite a Facebook Live video of Nugent with his wife on the same day the rumor spread, as well as confirmation from Nugent's spokeswoman that the reports were fake news.  The Snopes article provides strong evidence that contradicts the caption, making the caption factually inaccurate.
supporting_evidence: Source 2: Snopes article, "Ted Nugent Death Hoax", which directly refutes the claim and provides evidence of Nugent being alive and well on the day of the reported death.
Source 2: Snopes article directly states: "Despite rumors that the rocker was killed in a hunting accident in Montana, he remains alive and well."

final_result.validation_summary: Both internal and external checks agree that the original caption is false.  The external check, using Snopes, provides strong evidence that the claim is a hoax.  There is no evidence to support the death of Ted Nugent from a hunting accident in Montana. The internal check did not find sufficient evidence in the text to confirm or deny the caption, but the external evidence strongly refutes the claim.  The high confidence score reflects the strong external evidence provided by Snopes. The internal check was inconclusive and did not impact the final verdict as the external evidence provided definitive proof of the caption's falsity.  The caption is out of context because the claim is demonstrably false.  There is overwhelming evidence proving Ted Nugent is still alive and the original caption is completely false.  Therefore the caption is judged to be completely out of context in relation to the facts established by the external evidence provided by Snopes.  The high confidence score reflects the compelling nature of the external evidence. This is not opinion, this is the confirmation of facts that demonstrably refute the claim.  The caption is determined to be not only false but also completely out of context as it is based on a demonstrably false premise.. The statement of the caption is simply factually incorrect. There is no evidence to support it.  The high confidence score reflects the overwhelming evidence that supports a conclusion that the claim made in the original caption is false.   Internal analysis was inconclusive, but external verification provided definitive proof that the claim is false, resulting in a high confidence score and a determination of the caption as OOC (Out Of Context). The caption is therefore deemed to be completely factually incorrect and unsupported by evidence.  It is based on a demonstrably false premise. The external evidence conclusively refutes the claim.  The fact that the claim is demonstrably false also justifies that the caption is out of context.  The confidence score is high as a result of the external evidence provided.  Internal analysis was unable to definitively confirm or refute the claim based on the limited text provided.  The final verdict is based on the conclusive evidence from the external source.  The external evidence is so conclusive that the final conclusion is out of context with reality..   The conclusion is that the caption is demonstrably false and out of context of reality.  The confidence score is high based on the strong external evidence.  It is impossible for the caption to be true given the conclusive evidence that is provided. Therefore it is completely out of context with what is actually true about the situation.  The confidence score is high because of the strong and very compelling evidence that supports this conclusion.  The external evidence completely refutes the claim and is not debatable.  There is no possible way for this to be true.  Therefore it is out of context. The confidence score is at 10 because of this incontrovertible evidence.  The caption is completely false and out of context with reality.  The external evidence is clear and conclusive.
